basics.label: Loves technology and people, loves teaching üßë‚Äçüíª
basics.summary: An open-source advocate with software/‚Äãhardware exposure and 10 years of software development/‚Äãteaching experience.

work.name: Autohaus Twardowski GmbH (Wegberg)
work.summary: Conceptualized and planned an ERP solution using open-source software.
highlights: Performed a meticulous study ensuring Frappe Framework/ERPNext's ability to meet requirements.
Planned a hardware ERP integration to check in vehicles automatically using the OBD-II interface, and possibly track their location throughout their lifecycle at the Autohaus.

work.name: Reboot Mobility GmbH (Cologne)
work.summary: Created a Business-Intelligence (BI) dashboard using open-source components.
highlights: Built a BI dashboard using PostgreSQL and Apache Superset.
Crafted and optimized the SQL expressions for the different charts in the dashboard.
Worked closely with the account managers to develop meaningful cockpit analytics/metrics.

work.name: Wild Code School (Berlin)
work.summary: Taught full-stack web development to 2 consecutive student cohorts.
highlights: Led an industry collaboration with REMONDIS group, leading to a professional app prototype, which was designed and programmed by the students of the Full-Stack Development program.
Created innovative teaching tools using a JS compiler called Babel, to explain functions and loops (using "inlining" and "unwinding" code transformations).

work.name: RWTH University Aachen
work.summary: Taught, collaborated, and maintained IT infrastructure.
highlights: Drafted the innovation strategy for the Construction Robotics (CR) Masters, which was officially adopted by the institute.
Designed and taught two interdisciplinary courses which introduced students to GitLab, containers (Docker), and unpackaged software (Node & Python).
Led and managed the development of a cutting-edge UHF RFID system contracted by PORR and 3 other construction companies, as part of a research project.
Maintained the institute's IT infrastructure, including migrating data (ZFS), and implementing "ActiveDirectory" and Docker registry caching inside the classroom.

work.name: Precise Trading LLC (Dubai)
work.summary: Led the maintenance/tech-support MEA regional team.
highlights: Improved the 3D printer training and maintenance manuals.
Optimized the ticketing process for our MEA (Middle East and Africa) maintenance partners.

work.name: TechShop Inc. (Abu Dhabi)
work.summary: Started as a part-time, then transitioned to a full-time consultant in the makerspace.
highlights: Taught over 200 group classes in 3D printing, laser cutting, CNC routing/milling, 2D/3D design, plastic forming, metal working, woodworking, and electronics.
Developed CNC router/mill, casting, vacuum-forming, laser-cutting, and sheet metal show pieces, design examples, and instructions for makerspace members.
Brought the 3-axis HAAS CNC mill into function, which remained unused for years, including using it for paid work and opening it up to members of the makerspace.

work.name: Originbase LLC (Dubai)
work.summary: Started the makerspace along with 2 other people.
highlights: Taught over 100 group classes in rapid prototyping.
Revived the lost-wax casting equipment, which remained in storage for years, and used it to conduct jewellery-making workshops in the makerspace.

work.name: International School of Applied Sciences (Dubai)
work.summary: Worked as an elementary/mid-school, then as a high-school, teacher.
highlights: Taught the ICDL curriculum to elementary/middle/high-school students (ages 8-18).
Started an afterschool club in electronics and robotics.

education.institution: King Fahd University for Petroleum and Minerals (KFUPM), Dhahran (Saudi Arabia)

volunteer.summary: Acts as a lead barista and a member of the repair-cafe team.
highlights: Conducted various barista workshops on basic espresso brewing, milk-steaming for latte art, cappuccino style, pouring technique, and hot-chocolate art.
Currently designing a new website for the repair cafe.

For a year, have been conducting weekly classes to a 15-year old in Ghana spanning subjects such as financial management, professional communication, graphics design, text editing, markdown, GitHub, and using the Linux terminal. The laptop used by the juvenile was sent to Ghana from Germany.

projects.name: Excavator Simulator with Inverse Kinematics and Hydraulic Modelling
description: Developed a browser-based real-time simulation of a hydraulic excavator to enhance Construction Robotics Master's coursework at RWTH Aachen.
Enabled remote MQTT control for students, featuring inverse-kinematic (XYZ) trajectory planning and precise hydraulic system modeling.
Achieved high-fidelity simulation by compiling Simulink/ikfast C++ models into WebAssembly, which ran seamlessly using a webworker.
highlights: Simulink
ikfast
URDF
Three.js
